_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Carrera McLean Gas Plant
Executive Summary

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND RESPONSE POLICIES
The accidental release prevention and response policies for the Carrera McLean Gas Plant are maintained in the facility's Emergency Response Plan and RMP Manual.  Carrera Gas Company, LLC, is committed to the safety and health of it's employees, contractors and visitors.  The commitment is demonstrated in the design, installation, operation and maintenance programs developed and implemented specifically for this facility.  Operation and maintenance personnel are trained in the appropriate emergency response procedures to follow in the event of an accidental release.  However, accident prevention is the ultimate goal and as such site-specific mechanical integrity program is being implemented and maintained.

FACILITY DESCRIPTION AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES
The Carrera McLean Gas Plant is located approximately 3 miles East, 1mile North and 1/4 mile West of McLean, Texas; Gray County.  It is a plant that is designed to extract liquid petroleum products (ethane, propane, butane, pentane and heavier hydrocarbons) from raw natural gas and at the same time produce pipeline quality gas (primarily methane).  The only process in the plant that contains an above threshold quantity of a regulated substance is the Y-Grade Storage Tank (liquid petroleum products).  There are no above threshold quantity toxic substances at the Carrera McLean Gas Plant.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM
The Carrera McLean Gas Plant has developed and implemented a site-specific accidental release prevention program that consists of a detailed facility mechanical integrity program and employee training program.  The mechanical integrity program was developed under the guidelines of manufacturer written recommendations, recognized/generally accepted good engineering practices, industry/regulatory standards and past operation history.  Employee training was designed to ensure/document employee unde

rstanding of facility operation and maintenance requirements.

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
The Carrera McLean Gas Plant has had no accidental releases in the past 5 years that have resulted in offsite consequences.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM
The Carrera McLean Gas Plant has developed and maintains a site-specific Emergency Response Plan (ERP) that includes actions to take in the event of an uncontrolled release of a hazardous substance.  The ERP includes the names and phone number not only of company personnel but also the names and phone numbers of support services (contractors, police departments, fire departments, medical services/hospitals, regulatory agencies, LEPC, etc.) that may be called upon for assistance.  Liaison with those agencies is maintained to ensure timely and proper responses.  Employee understanding of their responsibilities during and emergency situation is high priority.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY
Carrera Gas Company, believes safety is an issue that can always be improved upon.  Carrera continues to look for, develop and implement programs that will improve an employee's ability to identify and correct potential workplace hazards.  Carrera also endeavors to ensure policies, programs and procedures are developed and implemented to meet applicable laws, rules and regulations.  Employee understanding of these policies, programs and procedures is high priority.
